Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Culprit \Cul"prit\ (k[u^]l"pr?t), n. [Prob. corrupted for culpate, fr. Law Latin culpatus the accused, p. p. of L. culpare to blame. See {Culpable}.] 1. One accused of, or arraigned for, a crime, as before a judge. [1913 Webster]
An author is in the condition of a culprit; the public are his judges. --Prior. [1913 Webster]
2. One quilty of a fault; a criminal. [1913 Webster]
culprit n : someone who perpetrates wrongdoing [syn: {perpetrator}]
